contentrichtext.text: {{redirect|Giran|the Egyptian 2009 documentary film|Giran (film)}} {{Infobox settlement |name = Yilan |native_name = 宜蘭 |settlement_type = [[County-controlled city]] |official_name = Yilan City · 宜蘭市 |image_skyline = Yilan City.jpg |imagesize = |image_caption = Street of Yilan City |image_flag = |image_seal = |nickname = |seat = |seat_type = |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region = TW |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = {{ROC}} |subdivision_type1 = Region |subdivision_name1 = Northern Taiwan |leader_title = |leader_name = |area_total_km2 = 29.408 |area_footnotes = |population_total = 95,831 |population_as_of = January 2009 |population_footnotes = |population_note = |population_density_km2 = auto |blank_name_sec1 = |blank_info_sec1 = |website = [http://www.ilancity.gov.tw/] |pushpin_map = Taiwan <!-- the name of a location map as per http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template:Location_map --> |pushpin_label_position = <!-- the position of the pushpin label: left, right, top, bottom, none --> |pushpin_map_caption = Location in the Republic of China |latd=24 |latm=45 |lats= |latNS=N |longd=121 |longm=45 |longs= |longEW=E |blank_name_sec2 = |blank_info_sec2 = |blank1_name_sec2 = |blank1_info_sec2 = |blank2_name_sec2 = |blank2_info_sec2 = |image_map = }} {{Chinese|title=Yilan City|t={{linktext|宜|蘭|市}}|s={{linktext|宜|兰|市}}|p=Yílán Shì|poj=Gî-lân-chhī}} '''Yilan City''', historically spelled '''Ilan''' or '''I-lan''', is the capital of [[Yilan County, Taiwan|Yilan County]], [[Taiwan]]. It is on the north side of Lanyang River. The first [[Han Chinese]] settled there in 1802. The [[Yilan Plain]], in which the city is located, was once known as the Kapsulan (蛤仔難/甲子蘭) Plain or the Komalan (噶瑪蘭) Plain. These names, as well as that of Yilan itself, are derived from the [[Kavalan people|Kavalan]] tribe of [[Taiwanese aborigine]]s. *[[Area]]: 29.40 km² *[[Population]]: 94,188 people (2004) ==History== According to archaeological research, the Taiwan region has been inhabited since 20,000 to 30,000 years ago{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}}. Primitive settlements first appeared in the Yilan region 3,000 to 4,000 years ago. Later, the ancestors of the [[Kavalan people]] drifted to Taiwan by sea.{{Citation needed|date=March 2013}} The Kavalan people, and the [[Atayal people]] in the mountain regions, engaged in farming, fishing and hunting. ==Tourist attractions== * [[Taiwan Theater Museum]] * [[Memorial Hall of Founding of Yilan Administration]] * [[Yilan Distillery Chia Chi Lan Wine Museum]] ==Transportation== Yilan City is accessible by [[Yilan Station]] of the [[Taiwan Railway Administration]]. ==Sister cites== *{{flagicon|USA}} [[Leawood, Kansas|Leawood]], [[Kansas]], [[USA]] (1988) *{{flagicon|USA}} [[Madera, California|Madera]], [[California]], [[USA]] (1994) *{{flagicon|USA}} [[Lowell, Massachusetts|Lowell]], [[Massachusetts]], [[USA]] (1997) ==External links== *[http://www.necoast-nsa.gov.tw/user/Main.aspx?Lang=2 Northeast and Yilan Coast National Scenic Area] {{Taiwan Yilan divisions}} {{Taiwan-geo-stub}} [[Category:Cities in Taiwan]] [[Category:Yilan County, Taiwan]]
